uber.abstract:
Apache Kafka at Uber
Uber has one of the largest deployments of Apache Kafka in the world, processing trillions of messages and multiple petabytes of data per day. As Figure 1 shows, today we position Apache Kafka as a cornerstone to Uber’s technology stack and build a complex ecosystem on top of it to empower a large number of different...
uber.author: Yupeng Fu and Mingmin Chen
uber.title: Disaster Recovery for Multi-Region Kafka at Uber

uber.abstract:
Uber builds multi-sided marketplaces handling millions of trips every day across the globe. We strive to build real-time experiences for all our users.

The nature of real time marketplaces make them very lively. Over the course of a trip, there are multiple participants that can modify and view the state of an ongoing trip and need real-time updates. This creates...
uber.author: Uday Kiran Medisetty, Nilesh Mahajan, Anirudh Raja, and Madan Thangavelu
uber.title: Uber’s Real-Time Push Platform

uber.abstract:
Data-In-Motion @ Uber
At Uber, several petabytes of data move across and within various platforms every day. We power this data movement by a strong backbone of data pipelines. Whether it’s ingesting the data from millions of Uber trips or transforming the ingested data for analytical and machine learning models, it all runs through these pipelines. To put it in...
uber.author: Sriharsha Chintalapani and Sandeep Karmakar
uber.title: No Code Workflow Orchestrator for Building Batch & Streaming Pipelines at Scale

uber.abstract: We originally open-sourced Horovod in 2017, and since then it has grown to become the standard solution in industry for scaling deep learning training to hundreds of GPUs.  With Horovod, you can reduce training times from days or weeks to hours or minutes by adding just a few lines of Python code to an existing TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Apache...
uber.author: Travis Addair
uber.title: Horovod v0.21: Optimizing Network Utilization with Local Gradient Aggregation and Grouped Allreduce

uber.abstract: Every day in over 10,000 cities around the world, millions of people rely on Uber to travel, order food, and ship cargo. Our apps and services are available in over 69 countries and run 24 hours a day. At our global scale, these activities generate large amounts of logging & operational data that runs through our systems in real-time....
uber.author: Sunheng Taing and Atul Gupte
uber.title: Turning Metadata Into Insights with Databook

uber.abstract:
About the Safety team & What we do

Uber is dedicated to keeping people safe on the road. The Safety and Insurance Engineering team is at the core of Uber’s business. We work to redefine what it takes to be safe on the roads at a global scale. Our technology enables us to focus on rider safety before, during, and...
uber.author: Safety Engineering Interns
uber.title: Meet the 2020 Safety Engineering Interns: COVID Edition

uber.abstract:
Introduction
Uber has a complex marketplace consisting of riders, drivers, eaters, restaurants and so on. Operating that marketplace at a global scale requires real-time intelligence and decision making. For instance, identifying delayed Uber Eats orders or abandoned carts helps to enable our community operations team to take corrective action. Having a real-time dashboard of different events such as consumer demand,...
uber.author: Yupeng Fu, Girish Baliga, Ting Chen, and Chinmay Soman
uber.title: Operating Apache Pinot @ Uber Scale

uber.abstract: The Uber Vilnius office is home to members of our Production Engineering, Infrastructure, Storage Platform, and Developer Tools team.
uber.author: Ieva Sapokaite
uber.title: Building from the Baltics: Meet the Uber Engineering Team in Vilnius, Lithuania

uber.abstract: In February 2019, Uber released Ludwig, an open source, code-free deep learning (DL) toolbox that gives non-programmers and advanced machine learning (ML) practitioners alike the power to develop models for a variety of DL tasks. With use cases spanning text classification, natural language understanding, image classification, and time series forecasting, among many others, Ludwig gives users the ability to...
uber.author: Travis Addair, Piero Molino, and Yaroslav Dudin
uber.title: Ludwig v0.3 Introduces Hyperparameter Optimization, Transformers and TensorFlow 2 support

uber.abstract: Uber as a platform invites its users to leverage it, earn from it, and be delighted by it. Serving more than 18 million requests per day, in 10,000+ cities, has enabled people to move freely and to think broadly while earning a livelihood on it. As one of the underlying engines, Uber Money fulfills some of the most important...
uber.author: Aakriti Singla and Simon Wu
uber.title: Revolutionizing Money Movements  at Scale with Strong Data Consistency

uber.abstract:
Jim Jagielski's fascination with open source software began out of necessity. He was working at NASA Goddard in the 1980s, and the agency had just received fancy new Macintosh computers loaded with Apple's new A/UX operating system. There was only one problem: None of the tools Jagielski needed ran on A/UX. It fell to Jagielski to port everything himself.

"That’s...
uber.author: Uber Open Source Office
uber.title: Spearheading Open Source: A Conversation with Jim Jagielski, Staff Technical Program Manager with the Uber Open Source Program Office

uber.abstract:
The making of Edge Gateway, the highly-available and scalable self-serve gateway to configure, manage, and monitor APIs of every business domain at Uber.
Evolution of Uber's API gateway
In October 2014, Uber had started its journey of scale in what would eventually turn out to be one of the most impressive growth phases in the company. Over time we were scaling...
uber.author: Madan Thangavelu, Uday Kiran Medisetty, and Pavel Astakhov
uber.title: Designing Edge Gateway, Uber’s API Lifecycle Management Platform

uber.abstract: Located in the heart of Latin America’s largest city, the Uber Sao Paulo Tech Center was founded in late 2018 as a company-wide hub for Safety Tech. The team is composed of product managers, UX designers, engineers and data scientists. As part of Uber’s mission to put the safety of our users first, our Sao Paulo-based Tech team is...
uber.author: Camila Carvalho
uber.title: Standing for Safety: Meet the Uber Sao Paulo Tech Team

uber.abstract:
Introduction
Recently there has been substantial discussion around the downsides of service oriented architectures and microservice architectures in particular. While only a few years ago, many people readily adopted microservice architectures due to the numerous benefits they provide such as flexibility in the form of independent deployments, clear ownership, improvements in system stability, and better separation of concerns, in recent...
uber.author: Adam Gluck
uber.title: Introducing Domain-Oriented Microservice Architecture

uber.abstract:
Millions of users use Uber’s applications everyday across the globe, accessing seamless transportation or meal delivery at the push of a button. To achieve this accessibility at scale, our mobile apps require low-latency and highly reliable network communication, regardless of where customers use our services.

The network communication for all of Uber’s mobile applications are powered by the edge and...
uber.author: Sivabalan Narayanan, Rajesh Mahindra, and Christopher Francis
uber.title: Engineering Failover Handling in Uber’s Mobile Networking Infrastructure

uber.abstract:
Project Homepage: GitHub

Over the past several years, increasing processing power of computing machines has led to an increase in machine learning advances. More and more, algorithms exploit parallelism and rely on distributed training to process an enormous amount of data. However, the resulting need to increase both data and training impose great challenges on the software that manages and...
uber.author: Jiale Zhi, Rui Wang, Jeff Clune, and Kenneth O. Stanley
uber.title: Fiber: Distributed Computing for AI Made  Simple

uber.abstract: Uber built and open sourced nebula.gl, a tool set for full-featured geospatial editing in the web browser, to better visualize large-scale data sets.
uber.author: Georgios Karnas, Clay Anderson, and Xintong Xia
uber.title: Editing Massive Geospatial Data Sets with nebula.gl

uber.abstract:
Self-driving cars have long been considered the future of transportation, but they’re becoming more present everyday. Uber ATG (Advanced Technologies Group) is at the forefront of this technology, helping bring safe, reliable self-driving vehicles to the streets. Of course, this wouldn’t be possible without the work of the engineers building the ATG platform’s underlying technologies. 

As the senior manager for...
uber.author: Bea Schuster
uber.title: Profiles in Coding: Diana Yanakiev, Uber ATG, Pittsburgh

uber.abstract: Uber ATG's self-driving vehicles measure a multitude of possible scenario variations to answer the age-old question: "how does the pedestrian cross the road?"
uber.author: Steffon Davis, Shouheng Yi, Andy Li, and Mallika Chawda
uber.title: Inside Uber ATG’s Data Mining Operation: Identifying Real Road Scenarios at Scale for Machine Learning

uber.title: Meta-Graph: Few-Shot Link Prediction Using Meta-Learning

uber.title: Profiles in Coding: Christabelle Bosson, Uber Elevate, San Francisco

uber.title: Developing the Next Generation of Coders with the Dev/Mission  Uber Coding Fellowship

uber.title: Introducing Athenadriver: An Open Source Amazon Athena Database Driver for Go

uber.abstract: Uber AI released a new framework on top of Pyro that lets experimenters seamlessly automate optimal experimental design (OED) for quicker model iteration.

uber.abstract: Uber employs statistical modeling to find anomalies in data and continually monitor data quality.

uber.title: Enhanced POET: Open-Ended Reinforcement Learning through Unbounded Invention of Learning Challenges and their Solutions

uber.title: Introducing Piranha: An Open Source Tool to Automatically Delete Stale Code

uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Fostering a Culture of Sponsorship: Introducing Uber’s Engineering and Sponsorship Development Program

uber.abstract: Multi-tenancy lets Uber tag requests coming into our microservice architecture, giving us the flexibility to route requests to specific components, such as during testing scenarios.
uber.author: Amit Gud
uber.title: Why We Leverage Multi-tenancy in Uber’s Microservice Architecture

uber.abstract: To celebrate International Women's Day, we spoke with women from across the company whose work helps deliver impactful experiences for Uber users worldwide.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck, Wayne Cunningham, Stan Yee, and Bea Schuster
uber.title: Celebrating International Women’s Day: Meet the Women Building Uber’s Global Platform

uber.abstract: Uber shares our principles and goals for using and contributing open source software, providing visibility into our company's approach to open source.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh

uber.abstract: Managing multiple machine learning models to enable self-driving vehicles is a challenge. Uber ATG developed a model life cycle for quick iterations and a tool for continuous delivery and dependency management.
uber.author: Yu Guo, Khalid Ashmawy, Eric Huang, and Wei Zeng
uber.title: Under the Hood of Uber ATG’s Machine Learning Infrastructure and Versioning Control Platform for Self-Driving Vehicles

uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Profiles in Coding: Rick Boone, Core Infrastructure, San Francisco

uber.abstract: Uber engineers share their learnings on how to tune a Java Virtual Machine so as to avoid long pauses and other issues with garbage collection.
uber.author: Xinli Shang, Yi Zhang, Fengnan Li, Amruth Sampath, and Girish Baliga
uber.title: Tricks of the Trade: Tuning JVM Memory for Large-scale Services

uber.author: Kara Ortbal
uber.title: Building the Future of Mobility from the Pacific Northwest: Meet the Uber Seattle Tech Team

uber.abstract: We built a backtesting service to better assess financial forecast model error rates, facilitating improved forecast performance and decision making.
uber.author: Sam Xiao, Haoyu He, Pooja Kodavanti, and Ethan Meng
uber.title: Building a Backtesting Service to Measure Model Performance at Uber-scale

uber.author: Chris Lewis and Brendan Dean
uber.title: Counting Calories: How We Improved the Performance and Developer Experience of UberEats.com

uber.abstract: In October 2019, Uber hosted our second annual Moving The World With Data meetup, showcasing some of our most interesting data science challenges in 2019.
uber.author: Emily Bailey
uber.title: Women in Data Science at Uber: Moving the World With Data in 2020—and Beyond

uber.abstract: We implemented a Kappa architecture at Uber to effectively backfill streaming data at scale, ensuring accurate data in our platform.
uber.author: Amey Chaugule
uber.title: Designing a Production-Ready Kappa Architecture for Timely Data Stream Processing

uber.abstract: We engineered full SQL support on Apache Pinot to enable quick analysis and reporting on aggregated data, leading to improved experiences on our platform.
uber.author: Haibo Wang
uber.title: Engineering SQL Support on Apache Pinot at Uber

uber.abstract: First introduced by Uber Engineering in January 2019, Manifold is a visual debugging tool that enables users to quickly identify performance issues in machine learning models.
uber.author: Lezhi Li
uber.title: Open Sourcing Manifold, a Visual Debugging Tool for Machine Learning

uber.abstract: As part of Uber Visualization's all-team hackathon, we built SpeedsUp, a project using machine learning to process average speeds across a city, cluster the results, and overlay them on a street map.
uber.author: Bryant Luong and Lezhi Li
uber.title: Uber Visualization Highlights: Displaying City Street Speed Clusters with SpeedsUp

uber.abstract: Uber recounts its many engagements with the open source community during 2019, from contributing projects to joining and founding new open source support organizations.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh
uber.title: Uber Open Source in 2019: Community Engagement and Contributions

uber.abstract: To cap off 2019, the Uber Engineering Blog editors present a selection of our most popular articles covering a range of technical topics, from AI to mobile development.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck and Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Year in Review: 2019 Highlights from the Uber Engineering Blog

uber.abstract: In 2019, Uber's Infrastructure team built new services and systems to enable resource savings, efficiency gains, and greater resilience across our technology stack.
uber.author: Rick Boone
uber.title: Uber Infrastructure in 2019: Improving Reliability, Driving Customer Satisfaction

uber.abstract: In 2019, Uber AI built tools and systems that leverage ML to improve location accuracy and enhance real-time forecasting, among other applications on our platform.
uber.author: Zoubin Ghahramani
uber.title: Uber AI in 2019: Advancing Mobility with Artificial Intelligence

uber.abstract: Developed by Uber AI Labs, Generative Teaching Networks (GTNs) automatically generate training data, learning environments, and curricula to help AI agents rapidly learn.
uber.author: Felipe Petroski Such, Aditya Rawal, Joel Lehman, Kenneth O. Stanley, and Jeff Clune
uber.title: Generative Teaching Networks: Accelerating Neural Architecture Search by Learning to Generate Synthetic Training Data

uber.abstract: In 2019, Uber's Data Platform team leveraged data science to improve the efficiency of our infrastructure, enabling us to compute optimum datastore and hardware usage.
uber.author: Nikhil Joshi and Viv Keswani
uber.title: Uber’s Data Platform in 2019: Transforming Information to Intelligence

uber.abstract: We share technical challenges and lessons learned while productionizing and scaling XGBoost to train distributed gradient boosted algorithms at Uber.
uber.author: Joseph Wang, Anne Holler, Mingshi Wang, and Michael Mui
uber.title: Productionizing Distributed XGBoost to Train Deep Tree Models with Large Data Sets at Uber

uber.abstract: Plug and Play Language Model, introduced by Uber AI Labs, gives NLP practitioners the flexibility to plug in one or more simple attribute models into a large, unconditional language model.
uber.author: Rosanne Liu, Sumanth Dathathri, Andrea Madotto, Piero Molino, and Jason Yosinski
uber.title: Controlling Text Generation with Plug and Play Language Models

uber.abstract: By integrating graph learning techniques with our Uber Eats recommendation system, we created a more seamless and individualized user experience for eaters on our platform.
uber.author: Ankit Jain, Isaac Liu, Ankur Sarda, and Piero Molino
uber.title: Food Discovery with Uber Eats: Using Graph Learning to Power Recommendations

uber.abstract: Uber is presenting 11 papers at the NeurIPS 2019 conference in Vancouver, Canada, as well as sponsoring workshops including Women in Machine Learning (WiML) and Black in AI.
uber.author: Matthias Poloczek and Jason Yosinski

uber.abstract: Uber introduces RxCentral, an open source library to reliably and repeatedly connect Bluetooth devices using a platform-agnostic, reactive design.
uber.author: Kevin Babcock and Joe Soultanis

uber.abstract: Uber's 2020 AI Residency will focus on initiatives related to our self-driving car project through Uber Advanced Technology Group (ATG).
uber.author: Ersin Yumer, Zoubin Ghahramani, and Raquel Urtasun

uber.abstract: Uber’s observability engineers present their work on distributed tracing (Jaeger), sampling (XYS), and metrics processing (M3).

uber.author: Jon Sadka
uber.title: Uber Visualization Highlights: How Urban Symphony Adds an Audio Dimension to Visualization

uber.abstract: To simplify the Uber Eats experience for our restaurant-partners, we built Menu Maker, a web-based tool for seamlessly managing menus on the Uber Eats app.
uber.author: Paul Hou
uber.title: Introducing Menu Maker: Uber Eats’ New Menu Management Tool

uber.abstract: Uber engineers describe Cadence, Uber’s open source workflow orchestration tool, its architecture, and its use in a series of informative presentations.

uber.title: Conducting Better Business with Uber’s Open Source Orchestration Tool, Cadence

uber.abstract: Uber built beacon to improve vehicle location accuracy on our platform, leading to more seamless rider pickup and dropoff experiences.
uber.author: Hemabh Shekhar and Vivek Sankaravadivel
uber.title: Improving Pickups with Better Location Accuracy

uber.abstract: With the release of deck.gl version 7.3, Uber’s open source visualization tool now supports rendering massive geospatial data sets formatted according to the OGC 3D Tiles community standard.
uber.author: Ib Green, Chris Gervang, and Ian Villa
uber.title: Taking City Visualization into the Third Dimension with Point Clouds, 3D Tiles, and deck.gl

uber.author: Raquel Urtasun

uber.abstract: Uber's IT Engineering team builds the tools and systems that help other Uber employees do their jobs. Meet a few of these remarkable behind-the-scenes engineers.

uber.abstract: To accommodate additional ML use cases, Uber evolved Michelangelo's application of the Apache Spark MLlib library for greater flexibility and extensibility.
uber.author: Anne Holler and Michael Mui

uber.abstract: Uber has embraced Presto, a high performance, distributed SQL query engine, and joined the Presto Foundation. Meet the Uber engineers who contribute to and use Presto on a daily basis.

uber.title: Building a Better Big Data Architecture: Meet Uber’s Presto Team

uber.abstract: When developing Uber's self driving car systems, engineers found a way to identify edge case scenarios amongst terabytes of sensor data representing real-world situations.
uber.author: Khalid Ashmawy, Shouheng Yi, and Alex Chao
uber.title: Searchable Ground Truth: Querying Uncommon Scenarios in Self-Driving Car Development

uber.abstract: CTO Thuan Pham sat down with former intern, now employee, Sudhanshu Mishra to talk about his early experiences in the technology industry and growing Uber.

uber.title: On Internships, Career Advice, and Reaching 15B Rides: A Conversation with Uber CTO Thuan Pham

uber.abstract: Uber is honored to join the Presto Foundation, a new initiative hosted by the Linux Foundation, to advance the open source data processing community.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.abstract: Uber introduces Hypothesis GU Func, a new extension to Hypothesis, as an open source Python package for unit testing.

uber.title: Gaining Confidence and Improving Android Developer Workflows as a Software Engineering Intern at Uber

uber.abstract: At an April 2019 meetup on ML and AI at Uber Seattle, members of our engineering team discussed three different approaches to enhancing our ML ecosystem.

uber.author: Janice Lan, Rosanne Liu, Hattie Zhou, and Jason Yosinski

uber.abstract: We built Cyborg, an open source implementation of VectorDrawable for iOS, to more easily implement designs across our apps.

uber.abstract: Uber Engineering details how GraphQL integrated into our Customer Care platform, making for more targeted queries and reducing server load.

uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.author: Larry Wei, Tong Pan, and Senyang Zhuang
uber.title: Building the New Uber Freight App as Lists of Modular, Reusable Components

uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.title: Less is More: Engineering Data Warehouse Efficiency with Minimalist Design

uber.author: Eva Prodanova

uber.abstract: With zero downtime, Uber's Payments Engineering team embarked on a migration that would allow authorization hold logic to be written once and used across existing and future payments products.
uber.author: Shirish Gajera and Chris Blinn

uber.abstract: Dawn Woodard, Director of Data Science, considers travel time prediction one of Uber's most interesting mapping problems.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.author: Molly Vorwerck

uber.abstract: Uber Poet, an open source mock application generator, helped us determine if refactoring the application part of our code into a few large modules would make our overall Swift build times faster.
uber.author: Mahyar McDonald
uber.title: Introducing Uber Poet, an Open Source Mock App Generator for Determining Faster Swift Builds

uber.abstract: We redesigned Uber's web-based booking flow for riders who prefer a browser over the app, simplifying pickup options and speeding up interactivity.
uber.author: Madhur Chadha

uber.title: Ludwig v0.2 Adds New Features and Other Improvements to its Deep Learning Toolbox

uber.author: Alex Gajewski, Jeff Clune, Kenneth O. Stanley, and Joel Lehman

uber.abstract: In a selection of presentations delivered at a June 2019 Uber meetup, we discuss how to use H3, our open source hexagonal indexing system, to facilitate the granular mining of large geospatial data sets.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Visualizing City Cores with H3, Uber’s Open Source Geospatial Indexing System

uber.abstract: As head of Uber's Advanced Technologies Center in Paris, Francois Sillion and his team are responsible for supporting the R&D behind Uber Air, our effort to add a third dimension to our platform using flying vehicles.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Solving for Urban Air Travel: A Q&A with François Sillion, Director of Uber ATCP

uber.abstract: Uber's Marketplace simulation platform leverages ML to rapidly prototype and test new product features and hypotheses in a risk-free environment.
uber.author: Haoyang Chen and Wei Wang
uber.title: Gaining Insights in a Simulated Marketplace with Machine Learning at Uber

uber.abstract: Uber Labs leverages causal inference, a statistical method for better understanding the cause of experiment results, to improve our products and operations analysis.
uber.author: Totte Harinen and Bonnie Li
uber.title: Using Causal Inference to Improve the Uber User Experience

uber.abstract: Uber AI's Piero Molino discusses Ludwig's origin story, common use cases, and how others can get started with this powerful deep learning framework built on top of TensorFlow.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: No Coding Required: Training Models with Ludwig, Uber’s Open Source Deep Learning Toolbox

uber.abstract: Jennifer Anderson, a veteran of Silicon Valley technology companies, leads Uber's Product Platform organization, which hosts our core services. In this interview, she describes her organization and the lessons she has learned.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Setting the Pace: A Q&A with Jennifer Anderson, Senior Director of Engineering at Uber

uber.abstract: Uber's Destination:Web meetup series gives great insight about the most current web building tools and techniques. These three videos from Uber presenters offer tips on a mysterious design pattern, the Elm language, and Progressive Enhancement.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Learnings in Web Development: Design Patterns, Elm, and Progressive Enhancement

uber.abstract: A key challenge faced by self-driving vehicles comes during interactions with pedestrians. In our development of self-driving vehicles, the Data Engineering and Data Science teams at Uber ATG (Advanced Technologies Group) contribute to the data processing and analysis that help make these interactions safe.
uber.author: Steffon Davis
uber.title: Power On: Accelerating Uber’s Self-Driving Vehicle Development with Data

uber.abstract: On May 3, 2019, Uber’s Programming Systems Team hosted the Programming Systems and Tools Track of the company’s Second Uber Science Symposium, featuring a full day of talks by leading researchers and practitioners in the the field.
uber.author: Adam Welc
uber.title: Second Uber Science Symposium: Showcasing Developments in Programming Systems and Tools

uber.abstract: Architecting the Uber driver app for Android, which needs to run for extended periods of time in the background, involved a unique idea where Activities and Services were not included in the structural foundations.
uber.author: Yohan Hartanto and Brian Attwell
uber.title: Activity/Service as a Dependency: Rethinking Android Architecture for the Uber Driver App

uber.abstract: Uber Engineering Manager and open source software community member Felix Cheung talks about his work with the Apache Software Foundation, open source at Uber, and XGBoost, a machine learning library for optimized distributed gradient boosting.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Uber Open Source: Catching Up with Felix Cheung, Data Platform Engineering Manager

uber.abstract: On May 3, 2019, Uber’s Applied Behavioral Science team hosted the Behavioral Science Track of the Second Uber Science Symposium, featuring a full day of presentations delivered by leading researchers in the field.
uber.author: Laura Libby, Joshua Morris, and Candice Hogan
uber.title: Second Uber Science Symposium: Exploring Advances in Behavioral Science

uber.abstract: Learn how to use Kepler.gl for data visualization through our tutorial, where we show how easy it is to load multiple datasets into Kepler.gl to visualize traffic safety in Manhattan.
uber.author: Carsten Jacobsen
uber.title: Visualizing Traffic Safety with Uber Movement Data and Kepler.gl

uber.abstract: Implementing QUIC protocol against TCP over cellular networks on our apps led to a reduction of 10-30 percent in tail-end latencies for HTTP traffic.
uber.author: Rajesh Mahindra, Vinoth Chandar, and Ethan Guo
uber.title: Employing QUIC Protocol to Optimize Uber’s App Performance

uber.abstract: In this article, we share highlights from Uber’s annual Take Your Kids to Work Day celebration, an opportunity for the children of Uber parents to get a taste of what it’s like to work at a technology company.
uber.author: Amy Hooey
uber.title: Uber Engineering Celebrates Take Your Kids to Work Day

uber.abstract: In addition to joining the Urban Computing Foundation, Uber is contributing Kepler.gl, an open source geospatial analysis tool, as the organization's first hosted project.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Uber Joins Urban Computing Foundation, Contributes Kepler.gl as Organization’s First Hosted Project

uber.abstract: Uber builds upon the Lottery Ticket Hypothesis by proposing explanations behind these mechanisms and deriving a surprising by-product: the Supermask.
uber.author: Hattie Zhou, Janice Lan, Rosanne Liu, and Jason Yosinski
uber.title: Deconstructing Lottery Tickets: Zeros, Signs, and the Supermask

uber.abstract: Uber's Chief Scientist announces the launch of the Uber Research Publications Site, a portal for showcasing our contributions to the research community.
uber.author: Zoubin Ghahramani
uber.title: Introducing the Uber Research Publications Site

uber.abstract: To determine if it made sense to adopt Kotlin for our Android monorepo, Uber's Mobile Engineering team measured Kotlin build performance at scale across a variety of project structures.
uber.author: Edgar Fernandes, Thales Machado, Tho Nguyen, and Zac Sweers
uber.title: Measuring Kotlin Build Performance at Uber

uber.abstract: CatchMapError (CatchMe) is a system that automatically catches errors in Uber's map data with anonymized GPS traces from the driver app.
uber.author: Yuehai Xu, Congxiao Lu, Suneel Kaw, and Daniel Wolf
uber.title: Improving Uber’s Mapping Accuracy with CatchME

uber.abstract: Performing updates of individual records in Uber's over 100 petabyte Apache Hadoop data lake required building Global Index, a component that manages data bookkeeping and lookups at scale.
uber.author: Nishith Agarwal and Kaushik Devarajaiah
uber.title: Consistent Data Partitioning through Global Indexing for Large Apache Hadoop Tables at Uber

uber.abstract: We submitted Hudi to the Apache Incubator to ensure the long-term growth and sustainability of the project under The Apache Software Foundation.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh
uber.title: Uber Submits Hudi, an Open Source Big Data Library, to The Apache Software Foundation

uber.abstract: Noticing increased latency in our metrics platform, Uber engineers track down a bug related to stack growth in a goroutine, resulting in a fix elevated to the Go open source GitHub repository.
uber.author: Richard Artoul
uber.title: Optimizing M3: How Uber Halved Our Metrics Ingestion Latency by (Briefly) Forking the Go Compiler

uber.abstract: Base Web is a React component library which implements the Base design language to act as a device-agnostic foundation for easily creating web applications.
uber.author: Nadiia Dmytrenko, Chase Starr, and Gergely Nemeth
uber.title: Introducing Base Web, Uber’s New Design System for Building Websites in React

uber.abstract: Uber Technical Writer Shannon Brown offers three tips for creating concise, meaningful documentation.
uber.author: Shannon Brown
uber.title: Learning on the Go: Engineering Efficiency with Concise Documentation

uber.abstract: Celina Ward discusses her journey to engineering, what it was like to present at Kubecon 2018, and what’s next for M3, Uber's open source metrics platform.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Uber Open Source: Catching Up with Celina Ward, M3 Observability Engineer

uber.abstract: Uber Engineering Manager Marin Dimitrov shares his best practices for motivating an engineering team, keeping connected when your headquarters office is over 6,000 miles and 10 hours away, and leveraging open source software.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Bridging the Gap from Sofia to San Francisco: A Conversation with Engineering Manager Marin Dimitrov

uber.abstract: Uber's IT Engineering team scaled mobile device management on macOS by leveraging open source tools and custom API-driven Chef cookbooks.
uber.author: Erik Gomez and Nate Walck
uber.title: Scaling Mobile Device Management for macOS with Chef at Uber

uber.abstract: In this short tutorial, we show you how to build a Hello World! application using Fusion.js, an open source universal web framework suitable for building interactive web applications.
uber.author: Carsten Jacobsen
uber.title: Build a ‘Hello World!’ Application in 5 Minutes with Fusion.js

uber.abstract: Uber adopted workflow orchestration and Cadence, our open source orchestration engine, to better handle customer support ticket routing at scale.
uber.author: Ken Buckner
uber.title: Improving the User Experience with Uber’s Customer Obsession Ticket Routing Workflow and Orchestration Engine

uber.abstract: What began as a means of showing Uber's driver-partners their real-time earnings quickly became an extensible means of communicating not just earnings, but also incentives and other useful information within our new driver app.
uber.author: Zebing Zong
uber.title: Building a Real-time Earnings Tracker into Uber’s New Driver App

uber.abstract: Uber's Maps Collection and Reporting (MapCARs) team shares best practices when choosing which HDFS file formats are optimal for use with Apache Spark.
uber.author: Scott Short
uber.title: Uber Case Study: Choosing the Right  HDFS File Format for Your Apache Spark Jobs

uber.abstract: How engineers and data scientists at Uber came together to come up with a means of partially replicating Vertica clusters to better scale our data volume.
uber.author: Atul Gupte and Ritesh Agrawal
uber.title: Solving Big Data Challenges with Data Science at Uber

uber.abstract: Uber engineers offer two common use cases showing how we orchestrate machine learning model training in our data workflow engine.
uber.author: Jianyong Zhang, Eric Chen, and Sally Lee
uber.title: Accessible Machine Learning through Data Workflow Management

uber.abstract: The next Uber Open Summit, where we present our latest and most impactful open source projects, will be in Sofia, Bulgaria on April 20, 2019.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Announcing the Uber Open Summit Sofia 2019

uber.abstract: Uber engineers discuss the development of DBEvents, a change data capture system designed for high data quality and freshness that is capable of operating on a global scale.
uber.author: Nishith Agarwal and Ovais Tariq
uber.title: DBEvents: A Standardized Framework for Efficiently Ingesting Data into Uber’s Apache Hadoop Data Lake

uber.abstract: We spoke to Data Science Director Fran Bell about machine learning at Uber and what she finds most challenging—and rewarding—about her work.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Data Science at Scale: A Conversation with Uber’s Fran Bell

uber.abstract: We sat down with a risk strategy manager and a risk engineer to discuss how they build solutions to minimize risk in the Uber Eats three-sided marketplace.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Mitigating Risk in a Three-Sided Marketplace: A Conversation with Trupti Natu and Neel Mouleeswaran on the Uber Eats Risk Team

uber.abstract: First introduced by Uber in November 2018, Peloton manages resources across large-scale, distinct workloads, combining separate compute clusters.
uber.author: Min Cai and Mayank Bansal
uber.title: Open Sourcing Peloton, Uber’s Unified Resource Scheduler

uber.abstract: Uber leveraged machine learning to design our capacity safety forecasting tooling with a special emphasis on calculating a quality of reliability score.
uber.author: Ranjib Dey, Shrey Desai, and Ruogu Du
uber.title: Using Machine Learning to Ensure the Capacity Safety of Individual Microservices

uber.abstract: Developed by Uber, Kraken is an open source peer-to-peer Docker registry capable of distributing terabytes of data in seconds.
uber.author: Cody Gibb, Evelyn Liu, and Yiran Wang
uber.title: Introducing Kraken, an Open Source Peer-to-Peer Docker Registry

uber.abstract: Engineering interns from Uber's European offices talk about their experiences, including the projects they worked on, the people they worked with, and the social activities they engaged in.
uber.author: Linn Andenes
uber.title: The Uber Engineering Internship Experience: European Edition

uber.abstract: Our driver app's new server-driven preferences section enables driver-partners to customize their experiences to make the app better fit into their lives.
uber.author: Brett Dupree, Quynh Nguyen, and Bao Lei
uber.title: Architecting a Safe, Scalable, and Server-Driven Platform for Driver Preferences with RIBs

uber.abstract: In this article, we discuss Uber's journey toward a unified, multi-tenant, and scalable data workflow management system.
uber.author: Alex Kira
uber.title: Managing Uber’s Data Workflows at Scale

uber.abstract: Uber SRE Tatiana Romanova discusses her computer science background, journey to Uber, and work on the Payments Platform team in Amsterdam.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Profiles in Coding: Tatiana Romanova, Uber Payments Platform, Amsterdam

uber.abstract: In addition to providing official plugins, Fusion.js enables developers to build and integrate their own plugins by leveraging dependency injection.
uber.author: Carsten Jacobsen
uber.title: Creating Custom Plugins with Fusion.js, Uber’s Open Source Web Framework

uber.abstract: Horovod adds support for more frameworks in the latest release and introduces new features to improve versatility and productivity.
uber.author: Carsten Jacobsen
uber.title: Horovod Adds Support for PySpark and Apache MXNet and Additional Features for Faster Training

uber.abstract: Created by Uber in 2017, Pyro was voted in by the Linux Foundation Deep Learning Technical Board as the latest incubation project to join its foundation.
uber.author: Fritz Obermeyer and Noah Goodman
uber.title: Pyro Accepted by the LF Deep Learning Foundation as a Hosted Project

uber.abstract: We spoke with Fritz Obermeyer and Noah Goodman, Pyro project co-leads, about the potential of open source AI software at Uber and beyond.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Uber Open Source: Catching Up with Fritz Obermeyer and Noah Goodman from the Pyro Team

uber.abstract: Uber Sofia is also home to a vibrant community of women technologists, from software engineers and data analysts to designers and program managers.
uber.author: Eva Prodanova
uber.title: Meet Uber Sofia’s Women in Tech

uber.abstract: Uber announces the release of the Autonomous Visualization System (AVS) as an open source project. AVS is a standard for creating a visual environment based on sensor data from autonomous vehicles, with playback available in multiple formats, including the web and video.
uber.author: Xiaoji Chen, Joseph Lisee, Tim Wojtaszek, and Abhishek Gupta
uber.title: Introducing AVS, an Open Standard for Autonomous Vehicle Visualization from Uber

uber.abstract: Censored time-to-event data is critical to the proper modeling and understanding of customer engagement on the Uber platform. In this article, we demonstrate an easier way to model this data using Pyro.
uber.author: Hesen Peng and Fritz Obermeyer
uber.title: Modeling Censored Time-to-Event Data Using Pyro, an Open Source Probabilistic Programming Language

uber.abstract: In our ongoing series about rewriting the Uber driver app, engineer Kevin Babcock explains how we built the connection between the app and the Uber Beacon device, which displays a color remotely selected through a rider's app.
uber.author: Kevin Babcock
uber.title: Engineering Uber Beacon: Matching Riders and Drivers in 24-bit RGB Colors

uber.abstract: The Uber Science Symposium featured talks from members of the broader scientific community about the the latest innovations in RL, NLP, and other fields.
uber.author: Mahdi Namazifar, Gokhan Tur, Jeff Clune, John Sears, Rosanne Liu, Xu Ning, and Zoubin Ghahramani
uber.title: First Uber Science Symposium: Discussing the Next Generation of RL, NLP, ConvAI, and DL

uber.abstract: Uber AI developed Ludwig, a code-free deep learning toolbox, to make deep learning more accessible to non-experts and enable faster model iteration cycles.
uber.author: Piero Molino, Yaroslav Dudin, and Sai Sumanth Miryala
uber.title: Introducing Ludwig, a Code-Free Deep Learning Toolbox

uber.abstract: In this article, Uber’s Marianne Borzic Ducournau discusses why financial planning at Uber presents unique and challenging opportunities for data scientists.
uber.author: Marianne Borzic Ducournau
uber.title: Why Financial Planning is Exciting… At Least for a Data Scientist

uber.abstract: Ever wondered what it’s like to work in tech at Uber New York City? Just blocks from Times Square and Bryant Park, Uber’s new office in midtown Manhattan is home to more than a dozen teams, hundreds of employees (and growing), and a wide variety of engineering roles.
uber.author: Alexandra Sofen
uber.title: Building Locally, Scaling Globally: Meet the Tech Team at Uber New York City

uber.abstract: In its first year, the Career Prep Program, a collaboration between Uber and The Hidden Genius Project, demonstrated how technology-focused companies can embrace and reinforce values of diversity and inclusion among engineers, while having a positive impact in the community.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Increasing Representation at Uber through The Hidden Genius Project

uber.abstract: AresDB, Uber's open source real-time analytics engine, leverages GPUs to enable real-time computation and data processing in parallel.
uber.author: Jian Shen, Ze Wang, David Wang, Jeremy Shi, and Steven Chen
uber.title: Introducing AresDB: Uber’s GPU-Powered Open Source, Real-time Analytics Engine

uber.abstract: Uber Labs utilizes insights and methodologies from behavioral science to build programs and products that are intuitive and enjoyable for users on our platform.
uber.author: Priya Kamat and Candice Hogan
uber.title: How Uber Leverages Applied Behavioral Science at Scale

uber.abstract: Many people around the world use Android phones based on hardware developed in 2015 and earlier. Uber engineers explain how they developed a lightweight rider app to serve this global audience.
uber.author: Harshit Bangar, Prateek Garg, Uday Jalan, Manish Bharani, and Anindya Chakraborty
uber.title: Expanding Access: Engineering Uber Lite

uber.abstract: Uber intern Lau Skorstengaard shares his experience working on YQL, the graph query language for our in-house infrastructure state aggregation platform.
uber.author: Lau Skorstengaard
uber.title: Aarhus Engineering Internship: Building Aggregation Support for YQL, Uber’s Graph Query Language for Grail

uber.abstract: Uber built Manifold, a model-agnostic visualization tool for ML performance diagnosis and model debugging, to facilitate a more informed and actionable model iteration process.
uber.author: Lezhi Li and Yang Wang
uber.title: Manifold: A Model-Agnostic Visual Debugging Tool for Machine Learning at Uber

uber.abstract: In our ongoing series about rewriting the Uber driver app, engineer Chris Haugli explains how we designed the map display to be resilient, and always show the most useful information.
uber.author: Chris Haugli
uber.title: Building a Scalable and Reliable Map Interface for Drivers

uber.abstract: Uber AI Labs releases Atari Model Zoo, an open source repository of both trained Atari Learning Environment agents and tools to better understand them.
uber.author: Felipe Petroski Such, Vashisht Madhavan, Rosanne Liu, Rui Wang, Yulun Li, Jeff Clune, and Joel Lehman
uber.title: Creating a Zoo of Atari-Playing Agents to Catalyze the Understanding of Deep Reinforcement Learning

uber.abstract: Uber AI Labs introduces the Paired Open-Ended Trailblazer (POET), an algorithm that leverages open-endedness to push the bounds of machine learning.
uber.author: Rui Wang, Joel Lehman, Jeff Clune, and Kenneth O. Stanley
uber.title: POET: Endlessly Generating Increasingly Complex and Diverse Learning Environments and their Solutions through the Paired Open-Ended Trailblazer

uber.abstract: In this article, engineering manager Lili Kan reflects on her decision to lead Uber's Insurance Engineering team and discusses the challenges—and opportunities—of building insurance products for our platform.
uber.author: Lili Kan
uber.title: From Self-Driving Cars to Optimizing Claims Efficiency: My Unconventional Journey to Insurance Engineering

uber.abstract: Rather than shipping out our new driver app as a simple update to Android phones, Uber engineers delivered a dual binary package, enabling a safe and structured rollout of the new app while maintaining support for the previous version.
uber.author: James Barr and Zeyu Li
uber.title: How to Ship an App Rewrite Without Risking Your Entire Business

uber.abstract: During an October 2018 meetup, members of our Women in Statistics, Data, Optimization, and Machine Learning (WiSDOM) group presented on their technical work at Uber.
uber.author: Sreeta Gorripaty
uber.title: Women in Data Science at Uber: Moving the World With Data

uber.abstract: For Uber's Profiles in Coding series, we interview Uber Freight engineer Sylvain Francois to find out the nature of his daily work and his best tips for coders.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Profiles in Coding: Sylvain Francois, Uber Freight

uber.abstract: Our editors spotlight some of the year's most popular articles, from an overview of our Big Data platform to a first-person account of an engineer's immigrant journey.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck and Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Year in Review: 2018 Highlights from the Uber Engineering Blog

uber.abstract: Brian Hsieh, Uber's Open Source program lead, reflects on open source accomplishments, project launches, and collaborations in 2018.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh
uber.title: Year in Review: 2018 Highlights from Uber Open Source

uber.abstract: Uber's Head of Urban Computing & Visualization reflects on his team's work visualizing data to better understand urban mobility in 2018—and beyond.
uber.author: Nicolas Garcia Belmonte
uber.title: Four Ways Uber Visualization Made an Impact in 2018

uber.abstract: Jonathan Levi recounts his experience as an intern at Uber during Summer 2018, including building a useful project for the Uber Eats team.
uber.author: Jonathan Levi
uber.title: Interning at Uber: Building the Uber Eats Menu Scheduler

uber.abstract: Horovod, Uber's distributed training framework, joins the LF Deep Learning Foundation to help advance open source innovation in AI, ML, and deep learning.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh
uber.title: Horovod Joins the LF Deep Learning Foundation as its Newest Project

uber.abstract: We sat down with Horovod project lead, Alex Sergeev, to discuss his path to open source and what most excites him about the future of Uber's distributed deep learning framework.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Open Source at Uber: Meet Alex Sergeev, Horovod Project Lead

uber.abstract: Uber's new driver app leverages its offline mode along with a cash-drop system organized around restaurants so that Uber Eats customers can pay for deliveries with cash.
uber.author: Steven Austin
uber.title: Scaling Cash Payments in Uber Eats

uber.abstract: Uber AI Labs introduces a method for making neural networks that process images faster and more accurately by leveraging JPEG representations.
uber.author: Lionel Gueguen, Alex Sergeev, Rosanne Liu, and Jason Yosinski
uber.title: Faster Neural Networks Straight from JPEG

uber.abstract: Part of Uber's open source M3 metrics system, our query engine can support real-time, large-scale computation and multiple query languages.
uber.author: Benjamin Raskin and Nikunj Aggarwal
uber.title: The Billion Data Point Challenge: Building a Query Engine for High Cardinality Time Series Data

uber.abstract: Uber built Makisu, our open source Docker image builder, to enable the quick, reliable generation of Dockerfiles in Mesos and Kubernetes ecosystems.
uber.author: Evelyn Liu, Ed Oakes, Antoine Pourchet, and Yiran Wang
uber.title: Introducing Makisu: Uber’s Fast, Reliable Docker Image Builder for Apache Mesos and Kubernetes

uber.abstract: As part of the OpenChain Project’s governing board, Uber will help create best practices and define standards for open source software compliance.
uber.author: Matt Kuipers
uber.title: Uber Joins the Linux Foundation’s OpenChain Project as a Platinum Member

uber.abstract: During a September 2018 meetup, Uber's Payments Platform team discusses how this technology supports our company's growth through an active-active architecture, exactly-once payment processing, and scalability across businesses.
uber.author: Dmitry Chornyi
uber.title: Engineering Uber’s Next-Gen Payments Platform

uber.abstract: Uber's many data flows required modeling the data associated with a specific task, such as a rider trip, into a state machine. The state machine lets engineers focus on just the events needed to successfully accomplish a trip.
uber.author: Amey Chaugule
uber.title: Sessionizing Uber Trips in Real Time

uber.abstract: Metropolis-Hastings Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) leverage the discriminator to pick better samples from the generator after ML model training is done.
uber.author: Ryan Turner, Jane Hung, Yunus Saatci, and Jason Yosinski
uber.title: How to Get a Better GAN (Almost) for Free: Introducing the Metropolis-Hastings GAN

uber.abstract: In our continuing series about building our new driver app, Uber engineers discuss building its Optimistic Mode feature, which lets the app continue functioning while traversing network lag areas.
uber.author: Chris Francis, Chris McGrath, Flynn Howling, Jatin Lodhia, and Yohan Hartanto
uber.title: How Uber’s New Driver App Overcomes Network Lag

uber.abstract: Uber AI Labs introduces Go-Explore, a new reinforcement learning algorithm for solving a variety of challenging problems, especially in robotics.
uber.author: Adrien Ecoffet, Joost Huizinga, Joel Lehman, Kenneth O. Stanley, and Jeff Clune
uber.title: Montezuma’s Revenge Solved by Go-Explore, a New Algorithm for Hard-Exploration Problems (Sets Records on Pitfall, Too)

uber.abstract: Uber hosted its first Open Summit on November 15, inviting the open source community to learn about our open source projects from the engineers who  use them every day. Check out highlights from the day, including keynotes from the Linux Foundation's Jim Zemlin and Uber AI's Zoubin Ghahramani.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Collaboration at Scale: Highlights from Uber Open Summit 2018

uber.abstract: Uber’s Observability team built a robust, scalable metrics and alerting pipeline to detect, mitigate, and notify engineers of issues as they occur.
uber.author: Shreyas Srivatsan
uber.title: Observability at Scale: Building Uber’s Alerting Ecosystem

uber.abstract: Announced during the Uber Open Summit 2018, we extend our commitment to open source by joining the Linux Foundation as a Gold Member.
uber.author: Brian Hsieh
uber.title: Uber Joins the Linux Foundation as a Gold Member

uber.abstract: Uber welcomes Jan Pedersen as a Distinguished Scientist to our Uber AI group, where he will bring his extensive experience to our efforts in improving artificial intelligence and machine learning.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Experience in AI: Uber Hires Jan Pedersen

uber.abstract: Horovod, Uber's open source distributed deep learning system, enables NVIDIA to scale model training from one to eight GPUs for their self-driving sensing and perception technologies.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: NVIDIA: Accelerating Deep Learning with Uber’s Horovod

uber.abstract: The Uber AI Residency is a 12-month training program for academics and professionals interested in becoming an AI researcher with Uber AI Labs or Uber ATG.
uber.author: Theofanis Karaletsos, Ersin Yumer, Raquel Urtasun, and Zoubin Ghahramani
uber.title: Announcing the 2019 Uber AI Residency

uber.abstract: Samuel Zemedkun reflects on his immigrant experience and how his part-time driving through the Uber platform funded his education and inspired his decision to join the company.
uber.author: Samuel Zemedkun
uber.title: My Journey from Working as a Fabric Weaver in Ethiopia to Becoming a Software Engineer at Uber in San Francisco

uber.abstract: In our continuing series about building our new driver app, Uber engineers discuss designing the architecture of the mobile app using RIBs, our open source mobile development framework.
uber.author: Yohan Hartanto and Sami Aref
uber.title: Architecting Uber’s New Driver App in RIBs

uber.abstract: Quantile treatment effects (QTEs) enable our data scientists to capture the inherent heterogeneity in treatment effects when riders and drivers interact within the Uber marketplace.
uber.author: Matthias Lux
uber.title: Analyzing Experiment Outcomes: Beyond Average Treatment Effects

uber.abstract: We sat down with Uber's Head of Information Technology to discuss her journey to tech services, what she finds most challenging about her work at Uber, and how her team is setting the company up for success.
uber.author: Molly Vorwerck
uber.title: Engineering Sustainability: An Interview with Uber’s Head of Information Technology, Shobhana Ahluwalia

uber.abstract: Uber built Michelangelo, our machine learning platform, in 2015. Three years later, we reflect our journey to scaling ML at Uber and lessons learned along the way.
uber.author: Jeremy Hermann and Mike Del Balso
uber.title: Scaling Machine Learning at Uber with Michelangelo

uber.abstract: Uber developed Peloton to help us balance resource use, elastically share resources, and plan for future capacity needs.
uber.author: Min Cai and Mayank Bansal
uber.title: Peloton: Uber’s Unified Resource Scheduler for Diverse Cluster Workloads

uber.abstract: Home to Uber's Payments and Developer Platform teams, Uber Amsterdam is the company's largest engineering office outside of the U.S.
uber.author: Morgan Sebree
uber.title: Transforming Payments & Empowering Developers: Meet the Uber Amsterdam Tech Team

uber.abstract: Uber open source projects leads give updates on seven of our projects, all of which will be showcased at the upcoming Uber Open Summit 2018.
uber.author: Wayne Cunningham
uber.title: Preview 7 Open Source Projects from the Uber Open Summit
